content.en: Fluid Mechanics Optimization: Researchers are exploring the potential of deep reinforcement learning (DRL) algorithms in controlling and optimizing fluid mechanics problems. By teaching empirical strategies to artificial neural networks through trial and error, these algorithms can effectively control flow, reduce drag, and optimize sensor placement. They are also being used to develop control strategies for various flow configurations, including laminar and turbulent flows, weakly turbulent conditions, and flows with rotational oscillations. Additionally, DRL algorithms are being applied to reduce skin friction drag, suppress perturbations in convectively unstable flows, and achieve turbulent drag reduction in channel flows.
content.da: Fluidmekanik optimering: Forskere udforsker potentialet for dyb forstærkningsindlæringsalgoritmer (DRL) til at kontrollere og optimere fluidmekaniske problemer. Ved at lære empiriske strategier til kunstige neurale netværk gennem trial and error, kan disse algoritmer effektivt kontrollere strømning, reducere modstand og optimere sensorplacering. De bruges også til at udvikle kontrolstrategier for forskellige strømningskonfigurationer, herunder laminare og turbulente strømninger, svagt turbulente forhold og strømninger med rotationssvingninger. Derudover anvendes DRL-algoritmer til at reducere hudfriktionsmodstand, undertrykke forstyrrelser i konvektivt ustabile strømninger og opnå turbulent modstandsreduktion i kanalstrømninger.
